text: "Sun Glasses" is a song originally released by Skeeter Davis in 1965, which was written by John D. Loudermilk."Country Spotlights", Billboard, July 31, 1965. p. 14. Accessed July 23, 2016. In 1984, Tracey Ullman released a version of the song titled "Sunglasses", which became an international hit. ==Skeeter Davis version== Skeeter Davis's version reached No. 16 on Record Worlds Top Country Singles chart,"Top Country Singles", Record World, October 2, 1965. p. 31. Retrieved November 25, 2018. No. 19 on Cash Boxs Country Top 50,"Country Top 50", Cash Box, September 25, 1965. p. 42. Retrieved November 25, 2018. and No. 30 on Billboards Hot Country Singles chart."Hot Country Singles", Billboard, October 16, 1965. p. 56. Retrieved November 25, 2018. In 1966, Davis was nominated for a Grammy Award for Best Country & Western Vocal Performance - Female for her rendition of "Sun Glasses".2013 Induction Class - Skeeter Davis, Kentucky Music Hall of Fame. Retrieved November 25, 2018. | style="text-align:center;"|23 |} ==Tracey Ullman version== In 1984, Tracey Ullman released a version of the song titled "Sunglasses".Tracey Ullman - Sunglasses, norwegiancharts.com. Accessed July 23, 2016. Ullman's version spent 9 weeks on the UK Singles Chart, peaking at No. 18,Tracey Ullman - Full Official Chart History, Official Charts Company. Accessed July 22, 2016. while reaching No. 6 on Austria's Ö3 Hit wähl mit chart,Tracey Ullman - Sunglasses, austriancharts.at. Accessed July 23, 2016. No. 13 on Sweden's Topplistan,Tracey Ullman - Sunglasses, swedishcharts.com.
